page.title: 05The Manor House at Ashbury.
page.content: The Manor house was built in 1488.It is made from Chalk, Sarsen stone, Bricks , solid Oak timber and a Tiled roof.The Spences family live there. Their names are Willam, Tom, Mary and their parents Jenny and Jim Spence. They have lived there 10 weeks but MR. J.Spence grew up there as a boy. There are 12 rooms in the manor and they are all used sometimes .There are 4 chimmney pots and stacks.They own 2 vehicles but because it is a farm it has lots of tractors and Farm Machinery (for more information see farms ). Before it was a house it was a Rest House for monks travlling from Oxford to Avebury.The front Door is very old ,Mr.Spence thinks it's the original door. There are 27 windows in the house.The garden is 2 acres incuding the Orchard.It was owned by the craven Estate.
